      • doesConnectionExist

        public boolean doesConnectionExist(java.lang.String stationName,
                          java.lang.String anotherStationName)
        This method checks whether a connection exists between 2 stations.
        Parameters:
        stationName - The first station.
        anotherStationName - The second station.
        Returns:
        True if there is a connection, false otherwise.

        anotherStationName - The second station.
        Returns:

                       Station station2)

        The newly created connection.

      • addConnection

        public Connection addConnection(java.lang.String station1,
                       java.lang.String station2)
        This method replicated addConnection but allows the use of station names instead of objects.
        Parameters:
        station1 - The name of the first station.
        station2 - The name of the second station.
        Returns:
        The newly created connection.

      • getConnectionsFromStation

        public java.util.List<Connection> getConnectionsFromStation(Station station)
        This method gets all of the connections from a station.
        Parameters:
        station - The station to get connections from.
        Returns:
        The list of connections that connect to the parameter station.

      • getConnectedStations

        public java.util.ArrayList<Station> getConnectedStations(Station station,
                                                java.util.List<Station> availableStations)
        This method gets all of the connected stations to a station, using a list of available stations to pick from.
        Parameters:
        station - The target station.
        availableStations - The list of stations the station could be connected to.
        Returns:
        The list of stations that the target station is connected to.

        This method calculates the distance between 2 stations.
        Parameters:
        station1 - The first station.
        station2 - The second station.
        Returns:
        The float distance between the 2 stations.

      • getStationByName

        public Station getStationByName(java.lang.String name)
        This method finds a station by it's name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the station to be found.
        Returns:
        The station, if found, null otherwise.

      • getStationFromPosition

        public Station getStationFromPosition(IPositionable position)
        This method finds a station by it's position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the station to be found.
        Returns:
        The station, if found, throws an error otherwise.

      • createRoute

        public java.util.List<Station> createRoute(java.util.List<IPositionable> positions)
        This method creates a route using a list of positions.
        Parameters:
        positions - The list of positions that the route consists of.
        Returns:
        The list of stations that make up the route.

      • getStationsList

        public java.util.List<Station> getStationsList()
        Returns:
        A clone of the stations in the game for use in routing.

      • getIdealRoute

        public java.util.List<Station> getIdealRoute(Station destination,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Node<Station>> fringe,
                                    java.util.List<Station> availableStations)
        This method applies an A* Search graph to find the ideal route between 2 stations.
        Parameters:
        destination - The destination station of the route.
        fringe - The fringe contains the list of stations to be explored. Initially this should be an ArrayList> containing only a single node who'se data is the origin station of the route.
        availableStations - The list of stations that can be used in routing.
        Returns:
        The list of stations that make up the route.

      • getRouteLength

        public float getRouteLength(java.util.List<Station> idealRoute)
        This method finds the length of a route.
        Parameters:
        idealRoute - The list of stations that make up a route.
        Returns:
        The length of the route.

      • getEditableRoute

        public java.util.List<Station> getEditableRoute(java.util.List<Station> route)
        This method returns a route with all irreplacable stations removed. This is useful for finding stations that can be avoided in goals.
        Parameters:
        route - The list of stations that make up the original route.
        Returns:
        The route with irreplacable stations removed.
